univ.bigdata.course.mapreduce

Class MovieAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • univ.bigdata.course.mapreduce.MovieAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MovieAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    This class performs assigned tasks with the help of JavaRDD in SparkContext.
    It receives the the input and out file name in its constructor and keeps globally.
    Each tasks via a method is called with parameters uses this input file to load/reload the data and writes results into output file.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • moviesReviewWordsCount

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> moviesReviewWordsCount(int topWordCount)

        Returns the map of top reviewed words and with the word count.

        @param topWordCount The top count of the words.
        @return topReviewWordsMap The map containing to ${topWordCount} words and it count.

      • topYMoviewsReviewTopXWordsCount

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> topYMoviewsReviewTopXWordsCount(int topMovieCount,
                                                                                      int topWordCount)

        Extract movies, count and comments against the movies using SparkContext.
        Sort them by reviews count, then loop over the topMovies list sorted by reviews count and make a new map of words for these reviews
        Sort the list of type wordsCount map entries by count value, lexicographically will be preserved.

        @param topMovieCount The number of top review movies.
        @param topWordCount The number of top words to return.
        @return topMovieWordMap A map of words to count, ordered by count in decreasing order.

      • getTopKMoviesAverage

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Float> getTopKMoviesAverage(int topCount)

        For each entry retrieved from getTopKMoviesAverageNFW ( getTopKMoviesAverage - No File Write), writes in the output file.

        @see getTopKMoviesAverageNFW(int topCount);
        @param topCount - number of top movies to return
        @return topMovieScoreMap The list of movies where each @Movie includes it's average

      • getTopKMoviesAverageNFW

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Float> getTopKMoviesAverageNFW(int topCount)

        Extract movies, count and average against the movies using SparkContext but No File Write at this position.
        To be used by multiple methods sharing common logic.

        @see getTopKMoviesAverageNFW(int topCount);
        @param topCount - number of top movies to return
        @return topMovieScoreMap The map of movies where each @Movie includes it's average

      • totalMovieAverage

        public float totalMovieAverage(java.lang.String productId)

        Extract movies, count and average against the movies using SparkContext finally returns the total average. Filters the result against product/movie provided.

        @return movieRatingAvg The movie average score.

      • mostPopularMovieReviewedByKUsers

        public java.lang.String mostPopularMovieReviewedByKUsers(int topCount)

        Extract movies, count, reviewers and reviews against the movies using SparkContext and retrieves the movie that reviewed by K users.

        @param topCount - The number of top count users.
        @return The most popular movie reviewed.

      • topKHelpfullUsers

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> topKHelpfullUsers(int topCount)

        Extract movie, reviewer and its helpful values against a movie review using SparkContext.
        And calculates the top K helpful using using the values of their helpfulness.

        @param topCount - number of top movies to return
        @return sortedHelpfulUserMap The map of top K helpful users with their helpful value.

      • mostReviewedProduct

        public java.lang.String mostReviewedProduct()

        Extract movies/products, and their review scores in descending order and returned first product/movie.

        @return The most reviewed Product.

      • reviewedProductEntryList

        public java.util.List<<any>> reviewedProductEntryList()

        Extract movie, reviewer and its review scores against a product/movie review using SparkContext.
        and forms a list of product/movie with its review count in descending order.

        @return movieReviewedReducedTupleList A list of product/movie with its review count in descending order.

      • reviewCountPerMovieTopKMovies

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> reviewCountPerMovieTopKMovies(int topCount)

        Extract top ${topCount} movie, reviewer and its review count against a product/movie review using SparkContext.
        and forms a map of K entries of product/movie with its review count in descending order.

        @param topCount Top count for review.
        @return reviewCountMap A map top K product/movie with its review count in descending order.

      • topYMoviewsReviewTopXWordsCountNFR

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> topYMoviewsReviewTopXWordsCountNFR(int topMovies,
                                                                                          int topWords)

        Extract movies, count and comments against the movies using SparkContext but No File Write.
        Sort them by reviews count, then loop over the topMovies list sorted by reviews count and make a new map of words for these reviews
        Sort the list of type wordsCount map entries by count value, lexicographically will be preserved.

        @param topMovies The number of top review movies.
        @param topWords The number of top words to return.
        @return wordCountLinkedHashMap A map of words to count, ordered by count in decreasing order.
